column4: Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen treated again for cancer
column5: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp co-founder Paul Allen said on Monday he had started treatment for non-Hodgkin's lymphoma  the same type of cancer he overcame nine years ago.

column4: Tesla must defend lawsuit alleging abuse of foreign workers
column5: Oct 2 A federal judge has ruled that Tesla must defend itself at a trial over allegations it knew foreign workers at one of its facilities were threatened with deportation if they reported an injury and worked long shifts that violated forced labor laws.

column4: Tesla worried by China tariffs even as deliveries surge
column5: Tesla Inc  announced record quarterly car production on Tuesday but warned of major problems with selling cars in China due to new tariffs that would force it to accelerate investment in its factory in Shanghai. | Video

column4: UPDATE 4-Tesla worried by China tariffs even as deliveries surge
column5: Oct 2 Tesla Inc announced record quarterly car production on Tuesday but warned of major problems with selling cars in China due to new tariffs that would force it to accelerate investment in its factory in Shanghai.

column4: Tesla produced 53 239 Model 3s in third quarter
column5: Oct 2 Tesla Inc produced 53 239 of its Model 3 sedans in the third quarter and delivered 55 840 of the vehicles to customers  the company said on Tuesday.

column4: Dow closes at record but Facebook drags on S&P  Nasdaq
column5: NEW YORK The Dow hit a record closing high on Tuesday  but another drop in Facebook shares weighed on both the S&P 500 and Nasdaq  driving both to finish in the red. | Video

column4: US STOCKS-Intel helps Wall St shrug off Italy woes  sends Dow to record
column5: * Small-cap Russell 2000 drops for second day in a row (Changes comment  adds details  updates prices)

column4: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Intel powers Dow to record high
column5: Oct 2 A jump in Intel powered the Dow Jones Industrial Average to an all-time intraday high on Tuesday  while the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq were little changed as U.S. stocks  much like global peers  remained pressured due to Italy's troubles.
